page.title: 09 The Heritage Centre.
page.content: The Heritage centre is in the middle of Lichfield. It was originally the town church of St.Mary and there has been a church on this site for over seven hundred years. All the History of Lichfield is here in maps, models, displays, documents, embroideries and photographs and videos. St Mary's is still used as a church but many other things happen there. It is used as a place for elderly people to meet and and for visitors to see and read about Lichfield's History. There is a cafe and gift shop for visitors and also a day centre, where senior citizens can meet, to chat over refreshments in comfortable suroundings. They also hold Whist Drives, Bridge School, Scrabble and other table games, Keep Fit and Beauty Classes and have lectures and discussions on various subjects.
